source: CDC - Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

statistics.description: Female inmates have higher HIV rates than male inmates (1.3%)
Deaths have declined significantly with antiretroviral treatment availability
Hepatitis C rates are significantly elevated in correctional populations

keyFindings: Incarcerated populations face disproportionately high rates of HIV/AIDS
Women in prison have higher HIV rates than incarcerated men
African American women are disproportionately affected
Lack of consistent healthcare post-release contributes to poor outcomes
HIV testing and treatment in prisons has improved but gaps remain
